hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Contraction Breakout Fade in Low-Volatility Neutral Regimes
hypothesis_content.statement: In NEUTRAL regimes with 20-day historical volatility below 40%, a breakout from a 5-day consolidation range (defined as <1.5% daily range) that exceeds 1.8x the average true range will reverse 70% of the initial move within 2 trading sessions.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Low-volatility environments often precede false breakouts as market participants test liquidity. Breakouts on low volume suggest lack of conviction. Market makers typically fade these moves to capture spread and provide liquidity, forcing price back into the consolidation range.
entry_conditions: Breakout occurs on below-average volume (< 0.8x 20-day avg)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces 70% of the initial breakout move
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price continues another 1x ATR in breakout direction

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 60% of such breakouts continue trending in the same direction, indicating genuine momentum rather than false breakout.
